summary: AI chips and related hardware will receive the largest allocation of infrastructure spend over the next five years . Ongoing spending from cloud hyperscalers underscores strong commitment to data center buildouts and GPUs . These spending dynamics bode particularly well for semiconductor stocks .  McKinsey has called for investment in AI-related data centers . Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon are forecast to spend nearly $260 billion on capex this year alone . Integrating large language models (LLMs) and generative AI into their ecosystems has supercharged growth for megacap tech .  Platformsrecently told investors that it is actually raising its capex budget for 2025 . Broadcom stands to benefit from rising AI infrastructure spend in a couple of ways . Each company currently runs on both Nvidia and AMD chip architecture .  Nvidia, AMD, Broadcom, and TSMC are well positioned for accelerated growth for years to come . Each company plays a mission-critical role in the development of AI-powered services . The chart below illustrates the forward price-to-earnings (P/E) multiples .  Many investors are sitting on the sidelines waiting to see what management teams have to say in terms of financial guidance over the next quarter or second half of the year . As McKinsey models in its reporting, spending on AI infrastructure -- particularly chips and data centers -- should continue to experience robust growth . For these reasons, I would take advantage of any weakness among these chip stocks .  Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Tesla is planning to launch its first Robotaxi rides in Austin next month . The company is one of the biggest laggards in artificial intelligence (AI) stocks isTesla(NASDAQ: TSLA), whose shares have declined 15% year to date (as of May 15)  Tesla CEO Elon Musk is committed to launching the first Robotaxi rides next month in Austin, Texas . Musk's vision isn't just for Tesla to sell electric vehicles, but he has his sights set on building an autonomous vehicle fleet .  A core part of the AI thesis around Tesla is rooted in the Robotaxi business being successful . Musk signaled to investors that "the real question from [a] financial standpoint is when does it really become material and affect [the] bottom line"  If Tesla does indeed launch Robotaxi next month in Austin, my hunch is that shares will skyrocket . Tesla stock has been creeping up as of late -- and there's no clear reason .  If Robotaxi does prove to be a lucrative extension of Tesla's EV business, investors will have ample opportunities to invest in the stock as the business evolves into more of an AI player than a car manufacturer . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late. A bipartisan group of eight U.S. lawmakers has introduced a bill requiring makers of artificial intelligence chips to include technology that verifies the location of their chips before exporting them . The bill comes shortly after US President Donald Trump began his tour of the Middle East this week, announcing several deals that will send AI chips to countries in the region .  NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) specializes in AI-driven solutions, offering platforms for data centers, self-driving cars, robotics, and cloud services . On May 14, BofA raised the firm’s price target on the stock to $160 from $150 and kept a “Buy” rating .  Nvidia announced a multi-year AI infrastructure project with Saudi Arabian AI startup HUMAIN . The firm believes the project is likely to be around $3B to $5B annually . Overall, NVDAranks 3rdon our list of AI stocks on Wall Street's radar .

US President Donald Trump wrapped up his tour of the Middle East today, concluding numerous high-profile deals and diplomatic engagements with countries such as Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates . Trump inked a massive AI data centre project where the two countries will be partnering on an artificial intelligence campus . This marks a significant step forward in Abu Dhabi’s efforts to become a global AI hub .  The US and UAE have agreed to establish a “US-UAE AI Acceleration Partnership” framework . The countries did not specify which AI chips from Nvidia or other companies could be included in the data centres .  NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) specializes in AI-driven solutions, offering platforms for data centers, self-driving cars, robotics, and cloud services . Wedbush reiterated the stock as “Outperform” on Friday, May 16, stating that the supply chain checks show that Nvidia’s Blackwell chip continues to ramp up . Analysts on Wall Street currently have a consensus “Buy” rating on the stock .  Some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and have limited downside risk . Stocks entered the green for the year as investors cheered the US-China trade thaw . The "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks continued theirrenewed ascent . Earnings from economic bellwethers Cisco (CSCO) and Walmart (WMT) didn't completely suck .  Ex-Medtronic CEO Bill George says CEOs should get away from corporate guidance . He says earnings estimates and corporate guidance are useless in a backdrop where one social media post could blow up company's financial planning .  Walmart reiterated its full-year earnings per share forecast on Thursday after ratcheting down expectations at an investor event several weeks ago . Executives went on to say they would start raising prices (by raising prices)  If tariffs go back to pre-thaw levels, it may render guidance obsolete . Yet, the guidance is out there . Mattel CEO Ynon Kreiz decided to pull guidance altogether because of trade uncertainty . United Airlines (UAL) still has its double guidance range out there(which numerous execs have privately made fun of). Yet despite all the confusion, we have the Street looking for earnings growth north of 10% this year .  Earnings estimates and guidance have historically proven to be important drivers of stock prices . To the extent they no longer are, I view it as one more problem for investors to contend with in a challenging 2025 .

Nvidia Corp.’s SEC filing (13G) revealed that it held around 24.2 million shares, or a 7% stake, as of March 31 . Investors' confidence in CoreWeave appears to have risen multi-fold after this disclosure . The stake now is higher than the 5.2% stake known to the Street since the company filed its IPO prospectus .  JP Morgan analyst Mark Murphy raised his share price target by 54% to $66 (from $43) The company announced some new deals, including one from a hyperscaler customer (speculated to be Google) and another $4 billion expansion from an AI company .  CRWV has 100x upside potential, according to our report about thecheapest AI stock . CRWv is a company that has more than 1,000 patents on AI technology .

Nvidia will continue to benefit from strong global demand for AI infrastructure . Already a leader in the AI training market, Nvidia is also dominating the growing AI inference market . The company's stock has a strong chance of rising after its first-quarter results .  Nvidia is an undisputed leader, accounting for roughly a 90% share of the data center graphics processing unit (GPU) market . The company stands to benefit significantly from the rapid expansion in data center capital expenditures . Many cloud players reiterated their commitments to investing in AI infrastructure, which contradicts the narrative of a potential slowdown in AI spending .  Blackwell has been optimized for running inference workloads, such as computationally intensive reasoning AI or long-term thinking models . Nvidia announced plans to build up to $500 billion in AI infrastructure in the U.S. within the next four years .  In May 2025, the U.S. Department of Commerce revoked the Biden-era AI Diffusion interim rule, which was set to take effect on May 15 . With fewer restrictions on international sales, investors can expect stronger revenue guidance for the rest of fiscal 2026 . With 5.9 million developers in its ecosystem, this has become a solid competitive moat .  Nvidia's revenue growth trajectory has been exceptional for the past few years . The company guided for revenues of $43 billion, plus or minus 2%, in the first quarter of fiscal 2026 . Nvidia currently trades at 25.4 times forward earnings, below its five-year average of 69.2 times .  Nvidia's robust AI-optimized ecosystem, cutting-edge technological offerings, and historical tendency to report performance that exceeds guidance, there is a high likelihood that the company will deliver better-than-expected results in the first quarter . The company could also provide strong guidance for the second quarter of fiscal 2026 . With its current valuation, the stock seems well positioned to soar significantly in the coming months .  Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late . Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon .

Nvidia has a history of beating Wall Street's earnings estimates . Hints from several major customers are encouraging about the demand for Nvidia's GPUs . Strong demand could boost Nvidia's Q1 results and its outlook for the rest of the year .  Nvidia has topped consensus Wall Street earnings estimates in each of the previous four quarters by at least 5%. Granted, an earnings beat doesn't always translate to a bump in Nvidia's share price . But my hunch is that investors are looking for a reason to be bullish about the once high-flying stock again .  Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in his company's Q1 earnings call that Amazon Web Services has been aggressive in installing Nvidia AI chips as well as its own Trainium chips . Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and its parentAlphabet, highlighted Google's ties with Nvidia . CFO Amy Hood said in her Q3 earnings call, that demand is outpacing capacity for AI services .  Nvidia plans to launch its Blackwell Ultra GPU in the second half of this year . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated in his company's last quarterly update that demand for the new GPUs is "extraordinary" Google Cloud was the first cloud provider to offer Nvidia's B200 and GB200 Blackwell GPUs to customers .  Nvidia could beat earnings expectations and provide an optimistic outlook for the rest of the year . But if the trade dynamics change for the worse between now and May 28, that might not be enough to propel the stock higher over the near term . Over the long term, I think Nvidia's future remains bright .  Nvidia, Apple, Netflix and Netflix are all about to pop . If you invest $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009, you'd have $351,127! Nvidia: If you invested in Apple in 2008, you’d have $40,106! Netflix: $642,582! Now is the best time to buy before it's too late .  The Motley Fool has invested in Alphabet, Amazon, Microsoft, and Nvidia . Nvidia stock is up for sale at the end of May 28 .

Amazon's two growth segments can help propel it to a $10 trillion market cap . Compared to other big tech competitors, it has more room to expand profit margins in the next decade . Amazon's dual growth engines and profit margin expansion potential have the company poised to be the first stock to eclipse a $100 trillion valuation .  Amazon's combined North America and international sales were more than $500 billion over the last year . E-commerce is still less than 20% of retail sales in the United States and has steadily grown for decades . Cloud computing is getting supercharged by artificial intelligence (AI), which is taking the industry to become much bigger .  Amazon's cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services (AWS) is going to capture the majority of the company's planned $100 billion in capital expenditures in 2025 . I think AWS has a clear path to expand to $200 billion and eventually $300 billion in revenue over the next decade and beyond .  Amazon's combined revenue will eventually reach $2 trillion in the next 10 to 20 years . Amazon's competitors in big tech do not have the large addressable market afforded to Amazon by dominating both e-commerce and cloud computing . Amazon has a much clearer revenue growth path to help it achieve the hundreds of billions of dollars in annual earnings needed to warrant this valuation .  Amazon stock is my bet to be the first stock with a $10 trillion market value . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late . Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, available when you joinStock Advisor .  Amazon will be Wall Street's first $10 Trillion company, and it's not Apple . U.S. chipmakers Nvidia and AMD look poised to be the biggest winners from the recent Saudi Arabia announcement . The kingdom plans to buy a lot of chips from both companies to help power its AI ambitions . The deal should help both companies recoup some lost Chinese revenue .  Nvidia will begin by shipping 18,000 of its GB300 Grace Blackwell AI supercomputer chips . Deal could be worth between $15 billion to $20 billion in total spending over the length of the agreement .  AMD has struck a $10 billion deal with Humain to supply chips to Humain over the next five years . AMD also signed a memorandum of understanding with SDAIA to explore using AMD chips to power future AI-focused data centers . The deals should help replace some of the company's lost revenue to China, after the U.S. tightened export controls to the country .  Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates are looking to invest in AI and data centers . Even smaller countries like Singapore are allocating money toward AI . President Trump is willing to use the AI semiconductor dominance of the U.S. as a bargaining chip .  Both Nvidia and AMD are well-positioned to benefit from increased AI infrastructure spending . Nvidia is the clear leader in the GPU space with an over 80% market share . AMD has proven to be a leader when it comes to supplying CPUs for data centers . Two hedge fund billionaires with stellar track records bought Palantir stock and sold Nvidia stock during the first quarter . Israel Englander's Millennium Management added 986,457 shares of Palantir, quadrupling its position . The hedge fund also sold 740,500 shares of Nvidia, trimming its stake by 7%.  Citadel sold 902,486 shares of Palantir, tripling its position . The hedge fund also sold 1.5 million shares of Nvidia, reducing its stake by 50% Citadel and Millennium are two of the three most profitable hedge funds in history .  Palantir's first-quarter revenue increased 39% to $884 million . The company's AI platform fuses data from multiple sources (like drones and satellites) to improve battlefield situational awareness . The NATO deal comes on the heels of the $100 million contract to provide multiple U.S. military services with access to Maven .  Palantir. commands an absurdly rich valuation of 64 times forward sales . The median target price on Wall Street is $100 per share, which implies 22% downside from the current share price of $129 . Current shareholders who plan to keep the stock for several years can sit tight, provided they are comfortable with volatility .  Nvidia reported impressive financial results in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025, beating estimates . Revenue increased 78% to $39 billion on strong sales growth in the data center segment, driven by demand for AI infrastructure . The company is truly unique due to its full-stack strategy .  Ken Griffin and Israel Englander trimmed their positions in Nvidia . Wall Street estimates Nvidia's adjusted earnings will grow 46% in fiscal 2026 . That consensus makes the current valuation of 45 times earnings look surprisingly cheap .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Computex kicks off Monday in Taipei, Taiwan, for years a showcase for cutting-edge AI chips and companies lining up to buy them . This year's event may well be on another far bigger personality: US President Donald Trump . Executives this time are likely grappling with the uncertainty of the Trump administration’s .  This year’s exhibition will of course feature the hardware required to bring artificial intelligence to life . But while they tout new products onstage, these companies are also confronting profound questions about the US administration's tariff regime . Trump wants manufacturing back home.  Asia’s biggest electronics companies may also find new opportunity in the Middle East . US delegation led by the president led by Elon Musk visited Saudi Arabia's Riyadh with lofty promises of new trade deals .  Intel’s Lip-Bu Tan, the newly appointed chief executive officer of Intel Corp., won’t be at Computex in a formal capacity . The promises from the likes of Samsung Electronics Co. about how transformative AI would be in day-to-day life have not come to pass .  Tan is currently weighing options to reform the storied US chipmaker . He’ll work to persuade customers of TSMC that Intel’s factories are a viable alternative . Tan, who served as CEO of chip-design software, is rebooting everything with a focus on better execution .  Chairman Liu will host a keynote presentation on Tuesday at Computex . Foxconn is working to diversify its revenue away from assembling smartphones and other consumer electronics . The company is also keen on advancing robotics .  Nvidia has been forthcoming with plans to upgrade its AI chips on a roughly annual basis . The company has also talked about the potential of AI in the robotics industry . Microsoft’s developer event, Build, is taking place the same week over in Seattle .  The scrapping of Biden-era AI chip rules will help the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia acquire more of Nvidia’s technology . Huang joined a US delegation to the Middle East led by the president, lauding the opening up of trade .

Analysts at Bank of America are bullish on chip stocks like Nvidia . Recent mega-deals in the Middle East point to continued demand for AI computing power . AI chips have become so important globally they are like a form of currency in geopolitical talks .  "sovereign AI" deals could represent more than $50 billion annually in the overall $450 billion-$500 billion global AI infrastructure market opportunity, BofA said . Nvidia and AMD are poised to be the biggest winners from the Saudi project, the analysts said .  Nvidia is seen as abargaining chip in U.S.-China trade talks . Deal with Humain represents next steps in Trump's efforts to court Mideast countries . Deal elevates Nvidia's role in global AI development .  The region could add a trillion dollars to the market opportunity for AI over the next decade . “With China still a tenuous situation, I think it’s a watershed moment,” he added .

Rigetti Computing has emerged as one of the hottest names fueling the quantum computing movement . While its rapid ascent in share price may tempt investors to buy, the company's financial profile suggests the company still has a long way to go .  Rigetti Computing has seen its shares rise by 521% in just the last six months . As the prospects of quantum computing gain more momentum, could Rigetti be on its way to becoming the next Nvidia? The total addressable market for quantum computingis expected to reach $131 billion over the next 15 years .  Quantum computing doesn't have many use cases for today's AI applications . This is underscored by Rigetti's paltry $10.8 million in annual sales . While the market size is expected to grow by billions over the coming years, developing quantum computing technology is going to require hefty investments .  The parabolic rise in Rigetti's stock price is rooted more in momentum trading -- a feature often exhibited by meme stocks . I suspect savvy investors will come to realize that AI's biggest players such as Nvidia,Microsoft,Alphabet, andAmazonalready have firm footing in this space . I see Rigetti as an extremely speculative stock to own .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisor's total average return is975% -- a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Ultimately, I would pass on investing in Rigetti, as I do not see the company as a true pioneer in quantum computing .  The Motley Fool recommends Alphabet, Amazon, Microsoft, and Nvidia . Nvidia is one of the 10 stocks covered by the Motley Motives . The Motives: Could Rigetti Computing be the Next Nvidia?

President Trump's blanket imposition of worldwide tariffs last month sent much of the market into free fall . Astute investors viewed the wide-ranging sell-off as a buying opportunity . Each of these stocks represented a compelling opportunity, and they are all still reasonably priced .  Nvidia is well-positioned to profit from this secular tailwind . In its fiscal 2025 fourth quarter, revenue of $39 billion grew 78% year over year . The full adoption of AI is expected to take place over years if not decades .  If Nvidia is the king of AI, Broadcom could well be the queen . Broadcom offers a vast array of semiconductors and infrastructure software solutions that power technology across the cable, mobile, broadband, and data center industries . The data center opportunity is where the majority of AI processing occurs .  As the world's largest online retailer, the tariffs announcement took a bite out of Amazon's stock . However, history has shown the company has been remarkably adept at adapting its business to changing macroeconomic and geopolitical situations . The recent pivot of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to become a hub of AI, and the reacceleration of its cloud growth, is a testament to its agile nature .  The threat of tariffs took a toll on many stocks, but Shopify was hit harder than most . The e-commerce platform's stock price plummeted by more than 40% from mid-February to early April . Despite the imposition of tariffs, small and large businesses alike continued to join Shopify's ranks .  Shopify's agility has served the company well, enabling it to adjust on the fly in even the most complex macroeconomic environments . The Trade Desk missed Wall Street's expectations but its own forecast, and the stock cratered . The company's stock is currently selling for 15 times sales .  In the first quarter, growth reaccelerated, as revenue of $616 million climbed 25% . The Trade Desk is also reasonably priced, with a price/earnings-to-growth (PEG) ratio of 0.92 .
